intro: Tessmannia baikiaoides, commonly known as the slender tessmannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
